results:
Based on the search results, I can provide information about the Polish translation of "Brave New World" (Nowy wspaniały świat) by Stanisława Kuszelewska in 1933.

The first Polish translation of Aldous Huxley's "Brave New World" was indeed translated by Stanisława Kuszelewska and published by Rój in 1933. The search results confirm this as the first Polish translation of the work.

Stanisława Kuszelewska (1894-1966) was the translator, and there was also a second edition of her translation published by Rój in 1935.

This translation by Stanisława Kuszelewska (1933) is referenced alongside Bogdan Baran's translation (1988) as the two main Polish translations of "Brave New World". The Kuszelewska translation is described as "completely outdated pre-war translation" (zupełnie już nieaktualny przedwojenny przekład Kuszelewskiej), while Baran's translation from the 1980s has been reprinted multiple times.

Kuszelewska's translation was later republished by Oficyna Liberałów in 1985, showing its continued use even decades after the original publication.

The search results indicate that this was indeed the first verification/publication of a Polish translation of Huxley's dystopian novel, making it historically significant in Polish literary translation history.
